creator: axel@boxfuse.com
text:
Tomcat fails to start when server.xml is a symlink (resolving to a valid file) instead of an actual file.

This is the message:

WARNING: Unable to load server configuration from [/tomcat/conf/server.xml]
SEVERE: Cannot start server. Server instance is not configured.

Copying the file to the symlink location fixes the issue, but in the Linux world that really shouldn't have to be the case.

creator: markt@apache.org
text:
Tomcat starts quite happily for me if server.xml is a symlink.

It looks like you are using a 3rd-party re-packaged version of Tomcat. You probably need to contact the packagers. To be sure it is a packaging issue, I recommend downloading a Tomcat distribution from the ASF and confirming symlinks work correctly. If you still see an issue with the ASF distibution, feel free to re-open this bug but you'll need to provide the exact steps to reproduce from a clean install of the latest stable 8.5.x release.
